intro: Patellocalamus gongshanensis, commonly known as the Gongshan grass, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, adapting to the cold and arid conditions of its habitat. Its flowering stems bear small, spike-like inflorescences, and it plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and forage for small animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat fragility, it is considered a vulnerable species.
